title: Remove Open Widget button and standardize date format to DD/MM/YY

requirements.text: Remove the Settings UI action that opens the widget view (the “Open Widget View” / open widget button) so users no longer see or can tap a widget-opening button in Settings.
acceptanceCriteria: Settings page no longer renders the button labeled “Open Widget View” (or any equivalent open-widget button).
The unused click handler (e.g., `handleOpenWidget`) and related imports (e.g., ExternalLink icon) are removed if no longer needed.
No navigation route or page is required to be deleted; only the Settings open-widget entry point is removed.

requirements.text: Change the app’s default date display format to DD/MM/YY wherever dates are shown to the user, including date+time strings (date portion) and date-only strings (e.g., exports). Keep time formatting in 12-hour format with AM/PM unless a screen is currently time-only.

quotes: And by default date should be in DD/MM/YY FORMAT

acceptanceCriteria: Any UI that shows a date (e.g., appointment-related messages, Settings “Last Synced”, exports’ date columns) displays the date portion in DD/MM/YY format.
Places currently using US locale date formatting (e.g., `toLocaleString('en-US'...)`, `toLocaleDateString('en-US'...)`) are updated so the resulting output is DD/MM/YY.

Places currently using date-fns formats for dates (e.g., `format(date, 'MMM dd, yyyy')` / `format(date, 'MMM dd')`) are updated so displayed dates follow DD/MM/YY (2-digit day, 2-digit month, 2-digit year).
No user-facing text is changed except as required by the new date format.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn UI sources); compose them instead.
Do not edit immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
nonGoals: Building a native Android/iOS home-screen widget (not supported in this web app).
Adding new widget functionality; this change only removes the Settings button that opens the widget view.
Changing backend data models or stored timestamp formats.
